intro: Swertia cincta, commonly known as the golden root, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Swertia cincta is known for its medicinal properties, often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its roots are typically harvested for use in herbal remedies.
